items.title: Important coverage from Denver Westword shedding light on the...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Important coverage from Denver Westword shedding light on the connection between the progress made in Elijah McClain‚Äôs case and the retaliatory and baseless charges against the organizers who have been at the forefront of the mass movement demanding justice.

PSL organizers Lillian House, Joel Northam, and Eliza Lucero, and Terrance Roberts of the Frontline Party for Revolutionary Action, lead organizers of the mass peaceful protests for #justiceforElijahMcClain, are all currently fighting a political prosecution that could put them in prison for as many as 48 years.

They've been charged. The officers involved in his death have not.

westword.com

Leaders of Justice for Elijah McClain Protests Headed to Court March 1

They've been charged. The officers involved in his death have not.They've been charged. The officers involved in his death have not.

items.title: Today, we held a car protest calling on Governor Jared Polis to...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today, we held a car protest calling on Governor Jared Polis to stop the coming wave of mass evictions and CANCEL RENTS & MORTGAGES! Coloradans, like people everywhere in the country, are suffering under the staggering weight of a year of extreme crisis. Over 15% of the state's population may face eviction in the coming months without REAL relief policies.

We demand:
1) Cancel rents and mortgages
2) No evictions...
3) No foreclosures
4)Full housing rights and relief for undocumented people
5)Homes for the homeless

Thank you to our cohosts Denver DSA, Sanctuary4All Colorado, Denver Homeless Out Loud, and 9to5 Colorado!

See More+31

items.title: RELEASE MUMIA NOW!
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

RELEASE MUMIA NOW!

+5Party for Socialism and Liberation - Philly

Political prisoner Mumia Abu-Jamal has COVID!

Mobilizing at a moment‚Äôs notice, his supporters including PSL members gathered in front of the District Attorney‚Äô...s office to demand that Mumia receive adequate medical treatment in a hospital and to keep up the fight for his release from prison. Conditions for all prisoners amid the pandemic are terrible, and tragically but predictably have led to mass outbreaks of the disease. This would not be the first time that prison authorities attempt to kill Mumia through medical neglect, but the people can stop them!

items.title: Via Answer Coalition: Colorado In what is now a rite of passage...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Via Answer Coalition: Colorado

In what is now a rite of passage for a new U.S. President, Joe Biden ordered a military assault on Syria on February 25, just over a month after assuming the presidency.

The Biden Administration excuse was ‚Äúself defense‚Äù ‚Äî but the idea that the U.S. can bomb Syria -- a sovereign country -- in self-defense while it occupies the country as well as neighboring Iraq flies in the face of all logic.

...

The only path to peace is the immediate and unconditional withdrawal of all U.S. troops from the region. U.S. troops out NOW!

items.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverThe Socialist Program with Brian Becker***Their Protests Forced New Investigation into Police...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverThe Socialist Program with Brian Becker

***Their Protests Forced New Investigation into Police Killing of Elijah McClain but Now They Face the Rest of Their Lives in Prison***

A damning new independen...t investigation into the police murder of Elijah McClain in Aurora, Colorado has been released, but the only people facing charges so far in this case are the activists who led the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Lillian House joins the show. Lillian and other leaders of a mass movement in the Denver/Aurora Colorado area demanding justice for Elijah McClain was herself arrested in a coordinated police attack on September 17, 2020. She was charged with multiple felonies and is awaiting trial. If convicted, Lillian House could be imprisoned for a half a century.

Listen here (and on all streaming platforms): https://soundcloud.com/‚Ä¶/their-protest-forced-investigation‚Ä¶

See More

items.title: 9NEWS (KUSA) ‚ÄúProtests in Aurora last summer forced open half...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

9NEWS (KUSA) ‚ÄúProtests in Aurora last summer forced open half a dozen new investigations into the death of 23-year-old Elijah McClain. Some of those demonstrations also resulted in dozens of charges, including some felonies, against several local protest organizers and leaders in two Colorado counties.

Now, lawyers and activists locally and across the country have come together to form the National Committee for Justice in Denver, calling on prosecutors to honor protesters' F...irst Amendment rights and drop all charges.

"Our goal is to make it clear that none of us are allowing this to be swept under the rug. These are young people in their 20s, and they're being told that they may go to jail for the rest of their lives,‚Äù said Mara Verheyden-Hilliard, a constitutional rights lawyer in Washington D.C. and the founder of the Partnership for Civil Justice Fund.

"Theirs are certainly among the most outrageous charges that we have seen leveled against racial justice demonstrators in the past year. That is certainly the case.‚Äù

See MoreA slew of local protest organizers and leaders still face charges, including some felonies, after protests last summer calling for justice in Elijah McClain's death.

9news.com

New committee in Denver fights charges against PSL protestors

A slew of local protest organizers and leaders still face charges, including some felonies, after protests last summer calling for justice in Elijah McClain's death.A slew of local protest organizers and leaders still face charges, including some felonies, after protests last summer calling for justice in Elijah McClain's death.

items.title: Elijah McClain should be turning 25 today. If it were not for...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Elijah McClain should be turning 25 today. If it were not for the Aurora Police, he would still be dancing and bringing light to this world.

APD officers Nathan Woodyard, Randy Roedema, and Jason Rosenblatt robbed Elijah of the rest of his life. 18 months since his murder, APD is still working to make sure there are no consequences for the killers.

But Elijah‚Äôs family and this community are not done fighting for justice. We continue to fight, demanding that:

...

‚Ä¢APD must immediately fire killer cops Woodyard and Roedema who remain on their force to this day.
‚Ä¢AFD must fire the paramedics who administered no care to dying Elijah, only a massive dose of ketamine.
‚Ä¢Attorney General Phil Weiser must file murder charges against killer cops Woodyard, Roedema, and Rosenblatt.
‚Ä¢The Aurora district attorneys must drop the false charges against the peaceful protest leaders who brought light to Elijah‚Äôs case. This is an attempt to bury Elijah‚Äôs case and end the fight for justice.
‚Ä¢And the city of Aurora must pay the McClain family restitution!

#JusticeforElijahMcClain #ElijahMcClain

items.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSLMany people in the United States today consider W.E.B. Du...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Many people in the United States today consider W.E.B. Du Bois to be a household name - and it‚Äôs not difficult to understand why. One of the founding members of... the NAACP, the first Black man to receive a doctorate from Harvard, and a prolific author, his personal achievements and contributions to Black liberation deserve enduring attention and celebration.

W.E.B Du Bois was born in 1868 amidst the Reconstruction Era in the United States, the heroic efforts of former enslaved Africans to form their own governments in the South after the Civil War, and remained a constant influence on Du Bois throughout his life. His history of the period ‚ÄòBlack Reconstruction‚Äô remains a classic to this day.

DuBois emerged as the main ideological opponent of Booker T. Washington and his Atlanta Compromise, a strategy that encouraged Black people to submit to white supremacist rule, and resign themselves to uplift via trade schools ‚Äî not to struggle for civil and political rights or equal education. DuBois challenged this arrangement head-on, forming the Niagara Movement, then the NAACP, which fought racist inequality in the full range of U.S. institutions.

W.E.B. Du Bois‚Äô commitment to Black liberation did not stop at the borders of the US. Du Bois stressed Pan-Africanism as a fundamental tenet in his philosophy of liberation. He attended the first and second Pan-African Conferences, meeting revolutionary leaders from around the world.

Du Bois‚Äô international solidarity took him on travels throughout the world, studying worldwide fights against oppression. Like many other revolutionaries throughout history, Du Bois came to accept socialism as the only way to end the oppression of all people. His visits to the Soviet Union and revolutionary China resulted in the McCarthy Era US government trying him as an international spy in a theatrical trial. In the last year of his life, Du Bois became an active member of the Communist Party of the USA, stating proudly, ‚ÄúI believe in communism. I mean by communism, a planned way of life in the production of wealth and work designed for building a state whose object is the highest welfare of its people and not merely the profit of a part."

See More

HAPPENING NOW: Call in to Aurora City Council public comment at 855-695-3475, press *3. Call before 7:30 or you may be pushed to the end of the meeting.

Demand Justice for Elijah McClain! The newly released report from the independent investigation commissioned by the city of Aurora confirms what we already knew: Elijah McClain was unjustly, illegally, brutally murdered and APD, AFD, and the city of Aurora did everything in their power to cover it up.

Demand the immediate firing of APD officers Woodyard and Roedema (Rosenblatt as fired for mocking Elijah's death), and AFD paramedic Cooper and lieutenant Cichuniec NOW!

items.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in DenverBREAKING: Independent investigation initiated by the city...
items.content_html:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverNational Committee for Justice in Denver

BREAKING: Independent investigation initiated by the city of Aurora just returned with its results.

It found there was no legal basis for the Aurora Police to s...top, frisk, or choke Elijah McClain.

Paramedics didn‚Äôt check on Elijah or even examine him before injecting him with an enormous dose of ketamine.

The initial investigators crafted questions to help exonerate the officers.

To this day the only people to face charges related to Elijah McClain‚Äôs death are the activists who led peaceful protests demanding justice.

Learn more at denverdefense.org
Read the report at auroragov.org

#JusticeforElijahMcClain
#DroptheChargesCO
